post.description: This endpoint is used to register an OIDC provider. This is used to configure the provider and link it to an organization

providerId.description: The ID of the provider. This is used to identify the provider during login and callback

domain.description: The domain of the provider. This is used for email matching

skipDiscovery.description: Skip OIDC discovery during registration. When true, you must provide authorizationEndpoint, tokenEndpoint, and jwksEndpoint manually.

scopes.description: The scopes to request. Defaults to ['openid', 'email', 'profile', 'offline_access']

id.description: Field mapping for user ID (defaults to 'sub')

emailVerified.description: Field mapping for email verification (defaults to 'email_verified')

entryPoint.description: The entry point of the provider

callbackUrl.description: The callback URL of the provider

id.description: Field mapping for user ID (defaults to 'nameID')

firstName.description: Field mapping for first name (defaults to 'givenName')

lastName.description: Field mapping for last name (defaults to 'surname')

organizationId.description: If organization plugin is enabled, the organization id to link the provider to

issuer.description: The issuer URL of the provider

domain.description: The domain of the provider, used for email matching

domainVerified.description: A boolean indicating whether the domain has been verified or not

domainVerificationToken.description: Domain verification token. It can be used to prove ownership over the SSO domain

issuer.description: The issuer URL of the provider

pkce.description: Whether PKCE is enabled for the authorization flow

clientId.description: The client ID for the provider

clientSecret.description: The client secret for the provider

scopes.description: The scopes requested from the provider

tokenEndpointAuthentication.description: Authentication method for the token endpoint

post.description: This endpoint is used to sign in with an SSO provider. It redirects to the provider's authorization URL

email.description: The email address to sign in with. This is used to identify the issuer to sign in with. It's optional if the issuer is provided

issuer.description: The issuer identifier, this is the URL of the provider and can be used to verify the provider and identify the provider during login. It's optional if the email is provided

providerId.description: The ID of the provider to sign in with. This can be provided instead of email or issuer

callbackURL.description: The URL to redirect to after login

errorCallbackURL.description: The URL to redirect to after login

newUserCallbackURL.description: The URL to redirect to after login if the user is new

loginHint.description: Login hint to send to the identity provider (e.g., email or identifier). If supported, sent as 'login_hint'.
